data.title: Chatham Daily News
data.meta_description: Charles Hutton passed away. This is the full obituary where you can express condolences and share memories. Published in the Chatham Daily News on 2015-09-02.
data.text:
HUTTON, Charles - Suddenly at the Chatham-Kent Health Alliance Chatham Campus, on Saturday August 29, 2015, Charles Edward Hutton, age 59, of Chatham-Kent, beloved husband of the late Vickie Hutton Sr. Born in Chatham in 1956, son of the late Margaret (Carey) Hutton and Oliver Scott. He is survived by his children Vickie Hutton, Deana, Kevin and Christal. Dear brother of Barb Tribble, John Hutton, Weonia Hutton, Leroy Hutton, William (Carmie) Hutton, Jerry Scott, James (Rita) Hutton and Douglas Hutton. Also sadly missed by 7 grandchildren, 2 great grandchildren and several nieces, nephews and cousins. Friends and relatives may visit at the Funeral Home, 156 William St. S. Chatham (519-352-5120) from 7:00 - 9:00 PM on Wednesday September 2, 2015. Funeral Service will be conducted in HINNEGAN-PESESKI FUNERAL HOME CHAPEL on Thursday September 3, 2015 at 11:00 AM with Rev. Leona Wright officiating. Burial will be in Maple Leaf Cemetery. Donations to the Heart and Stroke Foundation would be appreciated. Online condolences welcomed at www. peseski.com THE HINNEGAN-PESESKI FUNERAL HOME LTD. 519 - 352 - 5120

Published online September 2, 2015

Note: These are general guidelines; some florists may not be able to operate within these timelines. During peak periods such as Valentineâ€™s Day, Memorial Day and most holidays, florists are not always able to keep up to demand. Tribute will contact you if there are any issues.

Plant a tree: How does it work

When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.

An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.

After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.

Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.

Tree Planting Timeline

Orders placed in:

January - May

Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.

June - December

Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
